Reviews.Title: Great value...maybe the best on 39"
Reviews.Author: Hannibal Smith
Reviews.Content: I wanted a low-price replacement for an older tube unit, and this Sceptre had better than average reviews consistently(botht here and at Wal-mart's site too). The value for this price is outstanding and I am very happy with the purchase.The unit came boxed well and was undamaged despite the UPS driver pointing out a big tear in the carton. The interior padding saved the day! The setup was easy and everything in the QuickStart guide and manual was easy to understand.- Picture quality is a solid 9. The crispness and color are very good and very life-like.- Over-the-Air signal quality is also very good, I'd give it an 8+.- Audio is not super, but I havene't messed around with the equalizer settings myself, like many other reviewers reccomend. Persoanlly I plan to use my surround receiver for any movies/bluray output. Built in speakers get a 6 rating, as alone they are a bit low and occasionally tinny.- Connections get a 7, as I'd like a digital audio IN...however to be fair I knew that wasn't there when buying. And for this price I can understand why they have what they have.Overall rating 8+ for this TV, at week 5. Buy with confidence. Would recommend to any friend.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV
Reviews.Author: peaselove
Reviews.Content: The shipping was A+ very fast. The TV gets 5 stars for the price. Last year I paid about the same price for a 32 inch. The TV itself I would give just above average (for the price). The TV is plastic so it is pretty cheaply constructed. I have no problems with the picture as the quality is great. The sound is a bit below average. I will probably have to invest in a sound system. Overall for the price I paid which was $279 you cannot go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the Money
Reviews.Author: Sean
Reviews.Content: This is a great HDTV for the money. Dont get me wrong, its not up there with the Samsungs that are 3 times the price as this one. But for the money, I was overly impressed. The picture quality is stunning in full HD 1080p, and believe me, I have a skeptical eye. I own a CCTV distribution company and I used this in my showroom to display some of our Hi-Def 1080p cameras. My cameras look better on this monitor than any other that I have seen. The colors are so bright and vibrant and the blacks are very black. We have an expensive Samsung 52" at home and I would venture to say that this one's picture quality is on par with that one. Any of the other posters who complained of bad video quality were probably not using an HDMI connection. Rather, they were probably using a component connection and expecting HDTV quality, not gonna happen. This was so good that I just ordered another one for our showroom and I am considering the 50" version from the same company. The only thing I worry about is the long term usability, but I guess time will only tell. But my initial impression is A+!

Reviews.Title: Incredible Value & Quality
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: Things should be judged by their price point. You shouldn't expect Ferrari performance from a Hyundai - the world doesn't work like that.The same applies here. The TV is a fantastic value for what it offers.The "out of the box" experience is dull. The TV is pre-configured to "power save" mode when you first turn it on, meaning that the you might disappointed with the dark tones and overall unexciting image.Once I spent 10-15 minutes configuring the image settings (essentially getting rid of the power save mode on every setting), I was able to create a crisp, realistic and beautiful image - Incredibly solid.The sound is not the best, but it is also not the worst. It is sufficiently loud to handle my entire living room audience. The 30+ reviews I read on this forum depicted the sound of this TV to be of disgusting quality, which I think is exaggerated.

Reviews.Title: Sceptre X409BV-FHD
Reviews.Author: Admin
Reviews.Content: Update August 17, 2012I bought a blu-ray disc player today and finally tried this option on the tv. The tv supported the 1080p without a problem. While starting I saw 1080p/60hz, then once the movie was playing I saw 1080p/24hz I think it's how that was spelled. The streaming programs also looked great on the tv. So far I'm warming up to the tv. FYI, fry's has a 50 inch tv for like four hundred in case any one is looking.Update August 16, 2012I found that you can skip the channels you don't want on this tv tuner. This feature is found under Menu/Channel/Channel Settings. Here you will find small boxes, one says skip, the other favorites. This is where you add a check mark for channels you don't want to view and this is also where you'll find the check mark on the channels you have added to your favorites. Now the tv is more enjoyable as I don't need to scroll through channels I don't care for.Pros:-Built-in tuner. I'm glad to get rid of my separate box.-Okay size, I now know I can fit a slightly bigger tv where my old one was, darn. Even 40" still doesn't look that big, but I am loving the new size.-I love the side placement of the connections and buttons. Makes it easier to connect other audio/video components. You have to use small/thinner cables though or they will show on the side. Farther in would work best, but I still prefer this to having them on the bottom.-I thought I give sceptre a try since they are about an hour from me. My old no name brand lcd tv has been working fine all these years, but I wanted to get hdmi and 1080p.-Remote control is comfortable, a bit long but buttons are a good size, well at least the numbers arrows, and volume keys.-HDMI seems to work fine with my htpc. I now have the computer video and sound coming from the hdmi port. This got rid of two cables I had on my old setup.-Sound is okay, but I use separate speakers.-UPS couldn't find the house, but when they did, the box was fine, it was shipped in the original box, so I was expecting this to have a hole through, but nothing but a small tear on one side, so I'm glad.-The egg had it for 279 which is not a bad deal for this size, but I had to pay for tax so it was just over this 300. Other 32 sizes are going for more than this, so it was a no brainer to try this one. Unfortunately for me I had to pay for tax, but shipping was free so that helped a bit.-It's working!-It's surprisingly light compared to my smaller older LCD TV.Cons or just things I have found about this tv:-No picture in picture for a relatively new tv which I just noticed, this sucks. My 7 year old tv had it and it doesn't even have a tuner.-Many over the air HD channels are coming in as 1080i (Interlaced) not 1080p. I'm in Los Angeles and just use a regular antenna, no cable or dish. These still look fine, but depending on the program you can still see grainy or slight snow which can get annoying at times. This does seem to be more program dependent and more noticeable on lower HD programs, but still noticeable. After playing around with the settings, many do look better, but it's not perfect. A bit of wash (a bit too bright) too so I'm still trying to decide if I can live with it. I have yet to see anything in 1080P. I have turned off the dynamic setting, but still see some things a bit too white which sort of washes out if other stuff on the screen is light color.-Can't seem to delete channels I don't want, like my old separate tuner box. There is a favorites add/delete button so I guess I have to use this which I think sucks.-Remote buttons DON't light up which really stinks for a newer tv. A glow in the dark remote would work too.-Sceptre logo before tv starts, really annoying, it's a TV, we don't need logos on the screen when you turn it on, there's one on the front of the tv, we know what it is. Seriously?-The wall mount only has four screw holes. My old one had two sets which were closer and allowed me to mount my htpc, this one doesn't so I have to rig something up in order to mount that pc on the back of the tv. I used the base mount not a wall mount.-Blue LED on the front left corner is annoying since it stays on when the tv is on, turns red when off. I hate blue LEDs and this one is no exception. It's distracting to me but at least its smaller than others I have seen. I rather see a softer color, but nothing at all is better when the tv is on and even off.-1920x1080 on the htpc with windows 7 pro can only fit perfectly on the screen with the tv screen setting set at "Full 100%" and there is no setting to move the LCD left, right, up, or down like on a regular lcd monitor which is fine as I was able to use this setting. Unfortunately the screen seems a bit funny like when your video card settings are not set correctly. It's perfectly viewable, but when I go to an even lower setting the icon colors look much better, but the screen looks a bit fuzzy so I just use the setting above.-No internet applications or connection, so you can't update anything on it, period. What you get is what you get, nothing more, nothing less.I will update later on as time goes on to see how well this tv holds up. The X408BV/X409BV seem to be the exact same tv. I printed out both specifications and couldn't find any difference between the two. I ordered what the description said was the x408, but received the x409. There's no model number on the box, you'll see it when you take the tv out. At lest this is what the yellow sticker had. I'll have to check the back again to see which one it is. I forgot to look.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price, not state of the art quality
Reviews.Author: N. Mccorkle
Reviews.Content: Displayed black color is pretty bright, so the contrast isn't that great (mainly matters for scary movies I think).Screen backlight is uneven, can't always see it, but it's there. It appears as slightly brighter vertical bands, like a sine wave of brightness over the screen. My guess is they placed the backlight rows too far apart (if there are multiple bulbs), or didn't use a good enough diffuser.Haven't tried the speakers. Menu and ports are good. Overall a great TV for the size and # of pixels and price (I paid $289.99).If you're super crazy about movies and videography, look elsewhere, for the rest of us this is a pretty decent deal.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, great price
Reviews.Author: Robin Rennee DeSaye
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great clear picture, great color, plenty of HDMI slots, and is a great size for a great price.  I hung it on a wall - it is lightweight and was easy to hang by myself.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Product.
Reviews.Author: Oleem
Reviews.Content: Delivered in two days. It's surprisingly light weight.I have no problem with the quality of it's casing since the importance is all in the picture quality.So far I have no complaints.Remote came with batteries included.This 39in is lighter than my 27in. Makes for moving it around that much easier.The stand it comes on is a swivel so you can turn it without having to move the base.I have not tried to mount it nor do I think I will but the option is nice to have.The setup is pretty standard. As are the settings.I can't comment on the sound as I don't know the difference.It sounds just fine to me.Overall a great product for the pricing. Almost a steal. xDIt's now been 2 years since I purchased this product and I can't believe what I wrote here.I didn't give it nearly enough credit. I should have bought 2 of these when it was priced under $300.I still haven't mounted it but I still love the quality.There's no image burning or anything.This product is just beautiful. :')

Reviews.Title: WOW!!
Reviews.Author: Chris G.
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for use as a gaming monitor for both PC and my Xbox 360, and man, can i tell you its amazing!! It seems tailor made for use as a PC monitor, I'm using HDMI but it also has a VGA port, and its crystal cleat and scales perfectly!! Picture detail is awesome! I wasn't expecting too much as this is a very inexpensive TV, but its of a quality far beyond its price. I also bought a Tritton 720+ headset with this for use with my Xbox and PC to add surround sound, the coaxial audio out on the TV helped a ton! I just bought a Coaxial to optical converter, and Viola! Works great.  Only negatives i can see are that the stand is pretty flimsy, but the TV itself is incredibly light so its not a big issue, but its also easily wall mountable so that would solve that problem. And also, the screen is VERY thin. The slightest touch will disperse the screen for about 30 seconds, very unusual. This is fine for an adult household, but be wary if you have children, one smack and its over with.Otherwise this is a great buy, bust value in this size range and quality to boot! A+++!!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: joey@aws
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a second TV for my bedroom. Great price, picture is very good; sharp, bright and has easy to use configuration controls. Would buy again. Not as good as the THX top of the line Panasonic plasma in the living room, the colors aren't as deep, but I only notice it when I compare the two.  The Sceptre is well worth the price. The audio is fine once you configure it. It comes with "surround" as default. Turn surround off and the sound is fine. Also has a 7 band equalizer. Play with a couple of the bands to make the sound better.Other items of interest: TV is very light. Stand requires assembly (6 screws and it comes with a screw driver.) Remote isn't backlit.

Reviews.Title: first week and I love it
Reviews.Author: TIMMAY
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV on monday the 26th.  TV arrived on the 27th.  I decided to test out my netflix account on my PS3. to see how the picture looks.  I picked the movie Warrior to watch it is a movie about MMA.  There are alot of dark scenes in this movie so I had an oppurtunity to see how crisp and sharp the picture is.  I was very impressed.  This TV is a steal for $250-$300.

Reviews.Title: good tv love it!!
Reviews.Author: Kwon Young
Reviews.Content: very good tv at a very good price love it and thinking about buying another for my gaming room =)

Reviews.Title: cheap for a reason honestly...
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: I guess for every bargain comes bugs. Don't get me wrong I like the tv. the picture id give four stars but however the sound is kinda muffled and to b honest a little lousy. Its loud but it sounds like a muffled loud. Id give that 2.5 . But when I say bugs. the back insert to apply the wall mount to as I was putting it to the tv completely pulled out and now I'm either going to return it for fix or fix it myself. Thats why i give it two stars for packaging. If I had to really rate this tv it be a 3. Worth 249.50 but not a dime more then 300. Sound bar definately recommended. This is a honest review so to people looking at this tv know what they're getting into. I was excited at first but that definately changed once it was on.. thanks newayz Amazon. Decent tv at best. :(

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Jared "J"
Reviews.Content: I was shocked at how cheap the price was for the size. I proceeded with caution and read reviews on here and a few different sites to gauge the quality. I decided to buy it and I haven't been disappointed. I had to calibrate the visual settings which is typical seeing as most TV's don't come optimized for great viewing. It has 3 HDMI ports which is useful considering I have a PS3, sometimes like to attach my laptop and have other HD items connected to the TV. The base was simple to set up and even came with a screw driver. My only quarrel is that it doesn't pick up any digital TV channels which isn't a huge deal but still I'm sure for others is. Maybe it's where I have it in my room but nonetheless. This is my second HDTV purchase, I had a Samsung 32'' LCD TV a couple years back and honestly the picture quality on this is better. The sound as most people have said isn't the greatest but a reasonable sound system fixes that problem. Overall I'd rate it 4.8/5.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!!!
Reviews.Author: Paula SvedBaugher
Reviews.Content: I love the TV. I received the TV within two days after purchase. I got everything set up last night and I love the sound, the image and the easiness of set up. I am very pleased. Great product for an amazing price.

Reviews.Title: Decent Value
Reviews.Author: J. D. Andersen "Jim"
Reviews.Content: For the money, this is a decent value. I've been using it for about three weeks now. It does have its drawbacks, but then what product doesn't?Many others have complained about the audio quality.  To me it's a TV, not an expensive sound system.  For everyday viewing, sports, news, etc. the sound is okay. The level needed to hear the TV is a bit higher than I was used to, but I get by.  For viewing streaming I just run it through my home entertainment center. Picture quality is middle of the road.  The Toshiba LCD that this replaced had a sharper picture but it was considerably smaller in size.  Also the screen aspect ratio choices are less than with the Toshiba.  Not an issue with me really, but it might be with other users.On the down side the connection plug ins, HDMI and Component are on the side.  Depending on how your furniture is configured, it can be very unsightly.  Looking at the photos attached to the description, there doesn't appear to be any consistency with the input configuration.  One photo shows a rear input array and one shows them on the side.As an aside, less than a week after my purchase Amazon lowered the price by $19.00.  The 'low price guarantee' refund was handled very quickly and with only one request.  Kudos to Amazon for their quick customer service on this issue.

Reviews.Title: Skeptical at First, was not dissapointed!
Reviews.Author: Oliver55
Reviews.Content: When i first saw the TV on Amazon, I was very skeptical and thought there's no way this TV could be very good for so cheap, $268. I researched the model a little more, and discovered that it had an average of 4 star reviews (mostly docked one star because of the poor sound, but who buys a Flat screen expecting deep bass, room filling sound?). After shopping around a little more, I noticed that it was Amazons #1 LCD TV, and after purchase, I can definitely tell why:-Full 1080p HD-Feels sturdy, weighs 33 pounds-Sound quality is decent, 4/5 rating on sound accounting for expectations.-Plenty of inputs/outputs, Computer ready (VGA/HDMI) (3 HDMI ports)-VALUE, where else can you buy a New 39/40 inch HD TV for less than $300??Overall, if you are on the fence, BUY this TV, I recommend it.Owned about a month, I'll post an update in a few months to see how it holds up.

Reviews.Title: Sceptre X408BV-FHD 39-Inch 1080p 60Hz LCD HDTV (Black)
Reviews.Author: Mr. Hai V. Nguyen "haingu"
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV for $/Q ratio. I mostly made my purchases here based upon Amazon customer reviews. Many thanks to all who have shared their experience to facilitate my decision making.I have also contributed some of my experience in this forum. There is one idea I would like to add regarding basic questions about a product. Most manufacturers now have a website where owner manuals are available. I usually pick a product, read/download its owner's manual, read the reviews, then decide. I can say I can find answers to almost all of my basic questions through the owner's manual.I hope this help.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture, bad sound
Reviews.Author: J. L. Schmidt
Reviews.Content: Its a decently priced, cheap, large tv.  But beware, you're going to want to buy a sound system to go with it.  Its speakers are HORRIBLE

Reviews.Title: Best size per dollar value in the business
Reviews.Author: Falcon Fan
Reviews.Content: If you need a medium size TV or monitor, this is a good unit for the dollar. Don't expect great sports or video game performance, but very acceptable for regular TV. I use the monitor in the lobby of my business, and it's doing just fine. Have used other Sceptre computer monitors for about 20 years with good reliability and performance.Good for plain TV viewing or as presentation monitor.Not recommended for sports viewing (too slow) compared to plasma or faster LCD (120hZ +)

Reviews.Title: Nothing a soundbar can't fix
Reviews.Author: AMDFreak
Reviews.Content: Fantastic 39 inch TV.ProsCrisp clear picturevivid colorsLight weight3 HDMI inputsVGA inputConsSpeakers/audio system within the TVIn short I love this TV and it looks great in my living room. The Picture is fantastic but the audio is utter crap. Buy this one with a soundbar, you're going to need it.

Reviews.Title: just as described
Reviews.Author: jason e young
Reviews.Content: no issues...perfect for xbox.  no issues with display, resolution or otherwise.  Installed easily, and no issues after one month. buy this

Reviews.Title: What a deal
Reviews.Author: Atlantaman
Reviews.Content: Great picture, good design, arrived in 2 days....I can't believe the quality for this price... And it fits in my armoire

Reviews.Title: great value
Reviews.Author: J. Skilton
Reviews.Content: I got this from a pal who found it too big for his intended space, or I prob wouldn't have messed with an unknown brand.  Seems to be a ncie TV, though.  -Very-  bright, sharp and contrasty, with blacks that are really black.  I didn't get a manual, but it was very easy to set up.  6 screws to remove the stand, and the standard-size screw holes on the back fit within the range of my cheap wall mount.  It's also not very heavy, so no worries about wall mounting.  The sound, surprisingly, doesn't completely suck, just a little tinny, like most TVs, and better than many.  If all I watched were news and the occasional prime time masterpiece, I could live with this.  You'll probably want fuller sound, though.  There are both a headphone jack and RCA outs for your sound system.  Overall, the unit is thin, light, easy to use, and offers a great picture.  If it deteriorates or gives up over the next 6 months or so, I'll update.  But for now, appears to be a good basic TV by any measure, not just 'for the price.'

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.....
Reviews.Author: Patrick "Fishpistol"
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong I knew what I was getting and it works. As most have posted the speakers are terrible and they are. I don't even know why they are on there or if you could even call them speakers. This doesn't matter for me since I use my home theater system. The picture is ok. When I watch movies and netflix the lighting is not so good, darks are to dark and the highlights blow out. It's not bad and I knew for the price this was probably the case but you get what you pay for. It was cheap and fit in an old entertainment center we had. It's great for games and hooking up to the PC. In all I am happy with the purchase since I knew what I was getting.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your time
Reviews.Author: Munchkin's Momma
Reviews.Content: We've had the TV for only a little over a month and there are three bleeds in the bottom of the screen, for sure a waste of time and money. Should have saved it and bought a better TV. We will probably end up buying a new one within the next few months, if it lasts that long.

Reviews.Title: Great size, great picture, great price
Reviews.Author: lsufan18 "lsufan18"
Reviews.Content: Ordered this TV to put outside on our patio. It replaced a 32" that was a little too small. For the price, this is exactly what I was looking for. Only drawback is that I cannot program my DirecTV remote to turn the TV on or control the volume, but I think I can live with that.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Happy viewer
Reviews.Content: This is our very 1st flat screen TV.  We bases our decision bases on price compared w/ reviews. we are not AT ALL disappointed. The one review that was a common negative was volume. I must agree. It has some REALLY low volume issues. The room we have it in is small so it is not too big of a deal.

Reviews.Title: Great tv...great price
Reviews.Author: Drea Love "Drea"
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I wanted to turn around and buy something else, but I though nah, lets try it out.  I haven't had any issues with the tv..the sound is great, the picture is phenomenal and I overall love this tv.

Reviews.Title: A Great Value
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: If I could I would rate this tv two different ways.  First I would give it five stars in the category of price to value. I paid $278 for this tv and this is a great tv for the money.  I would give it 4 and a quarter stars for actual performane. No it does not have all the bells and whistles of a Samsung Smart Tv or a Sony Bravia and the picture is not quite as good but it also is way less money.  The picture is really nice to me the only thing is the blacks are not always deep enough in low light scences they are fine for brighter scences. I think what I am trying to say is in night time scenes there could be a little better contrast between dark colors but it is not a big deal. The tv lacks the ARC (audio return channel) feature that makes it easier to use your audio video receiver with your tv. I have a lot more HDMI ports on my receiver so I could connect more accessories easier.  You have to use a digital coaxial cable to get digital sound with your A/V receiver.  I have heard that ARC is better I don't know I haven't heard it but the sound using the digital coaxial cable is really good and definitely better than what you get with RCA or analog cables.  You have three HDMI ports on the tv and you can connect your laptop or a USB device to the set it works nicely. It is better with external speakers the speakers on the tv are only ok.  If you are watching a movie with special effects or a lot of action you will be much happier using external speakers or a receiver.Don't be afraid to try this tv because you have not heard of Sceptre. I knew of the company because I have one of their computer monitors it has a great display.  When I saw they made televisions too I didn't hesitate to try one. I also have a 32 inch version of this same tv also purchased at a great price. For the money these are great products.  Things don't always have to be expensive to be good.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price. Great for me.
Reviews.Author: Sam Lynch
Reviews.Content: I really didn't know anything about flat screens as this was my first tv purchase ever. One of my roommates got married and took his large tube television with him.  I thought surely was going to have to pay a good bit of money to replace it with a flat screen of comparable size or for another tube unit for that matter.  I had just jumped on Amazon to get an idea of what the damage was going to be and this tv was the first hit.  Naturally for the price I was curious and was even more surprised that it was getting great reviews across the board.  I'm usually a pretty wary person when it comes to online electronics but I've also learned how to trust my Amazon reviews.  Everything positive that everyone has said about the tv is true! I agree with most that the sound is not the best quality but I think it still deserves 5 stars from me because something like that is to be expected for the price.  Shortly after getting the tv, I purchased (on Amazon) a $60 set of 2:1 Cyber Acoustics speakers.  Great set up. Technically they are computer speakers, but again I trusted my Amazon reviews and they've been working great with the tv.  I use a ROKU with an HDMI cable for Netflix etc. I have the lowest quality ROKU but the quality is great on the tv.  I don't have a blue-ray so I actually find myself drawn to streaming Netflix through the HDMI vs. popping in a DVD through the A/V setup.  I'm not a super picky person about tv.  This is the largest and nicest tv I've ever had in my house. I do feel like I'm pretty easy to please but I immediately felt like all the positive reviews were confirmed when I pulled it out of the box and powered it on.  I think anything that would have given this tv 4 stars was overshadowed by the price.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the budget conscious
Reviews.Author: 4 season commuter
Reviews.Content: Is there tv's out there with a better picture quality and features....probably....but at this price?....no chance.  We have had a glass tube tv for almost 15 years and only decided to get a new one since the screen was really starting to dim and loose color.  We are not hard core tv or movie watchers probably <10 hours a week.  So when we wanted to get a new tv we wanted something that would offer good picture quality at an affordable price.  The audio is not the greatest but for everyday tv watching it is just fine, and the unti has an audio out allowing it to be connected to external sound.  For movies we route all the sound to a receiver and it works just fine.  The only thing we have found that is kind of annoying is the remote sensitivity.  You have to be right in front of the tv at a close range for it to respond.....but don't let this sway you from the purchase if you want good picture quality at a affordable price.  With HD programming the picture is crystal clear.  For a budget unit I don't feel like we were delivered budget features and quality, it meets all my expectations and more especially at the price.  So if you are a hard core movie/tv watcher looking for the best of everything.....go elsewhere, but if you want to upgrade without breaking the bank, and still have quality entertainment, this tv might just be what your are looking for.

Reviews.Title: VERY Pleased!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: taz
Reviews.Content: The price, size & quality is great! Easy setup and picture is 100% grade quality.... didn't think I'd love this tv but hands down I'm completely satisfied!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Tiara
Reviews.Content: Good packaging and wonderful tv. Very happy with my purchase it was a valentine's day gift and my hubby is happy.

Reviews.Title: sceptre t.v.
Reviews.Author: William McAlpin
Reviews.Content: picture is great,when connected to hd  service,sound needs improvement,could be a little better,overall t.v. great for the price,better than expected,suggest to anyone

Reviews.Title: Good picture but poor speaker quality
Reviews.Author: S. Powers
Reviews.Content: The bang for the buck on this TV is definitely good. The setup was easy. I had used the pedestal until I received the wall mount I purchased and both installations were easy. The main issue I have is with the sound and volume options. If you have anything going on at your house while you are watching a movie on it you have to max out the volume to hear the speaking parts of the movie.

Reviews.Title: A Good Purchase
Reviews.Author: Askeladden
Reviews.Content: The Sceptre X408BV 38.5" (40-inch class??) has delivered better video quality than I expected, for the money paid.  Although not monitored side-by-side with other brands, the video display is close to impeccable.  No pixilzation is observed in sporting performances characterized by lots of motion.  The colors, including black and white, are precise.  It has great, clearer definition with its 1080p picture scanning when compared to my 55", 1080i projection monitor.  The stereo sound function works, albeit the sound system, like many thin screen, t.v.s, leaves much to be desired; it's over-powered by high-frequency noises and results in a sound floor of shreaky, tinny, noise-rattling harshness.  This is not different from other brands of thin-screen televisions.  Consequently, a Boston Accoustics sound bar and sub-woofer from Amazon were subsquently added, and that completed the picture, so to speak.  This monitor is watched from a typical distance of 10 -12 feet, and it's nice to be able to read the fine print in the sports "time remaining and score bar" at the bottom of the screen.  The accompanying manual is very good, and addressed all set-up and subsequent beginnner's issues that came to the fore.

Reviews.Title: sounds weak
Reviews.Author: tb
Reviews.Content: Good picture,very weak sound ,sounds like the speakers are blown. Processor is a little slow,remote seams a little cheap.Price was good.

Reviews.Title: Perfect PC monitor; amazing array of options for audio and picture adjustment.
Reviews.Author: Brian Rose
Reviews.Content: I'm currently using this as a computer monitor, and it has been flawless. Why spend $200 on a 24 inch LCD Monitor when for 33% more you can get a 39 inch 1080p 60Hz Monitor?If you are considering doing the same thing, then have no worries; you have found what you are looking for. Within 5 minutes I had this fully hooked up and running on my PC. In fact, I'm using it to type this review. I will never squint to read a document again, and Battlefield 3 and Call of Duty are now a truly immersive experience.I took another 10 minutes to adjust the picture and sound to perfection. I was surprised how much fine tuning you can do to the picture, and especially the audio. Besides the ability to adjust the bass, treble, and balance, you can open the equalizer and adjust the individual frequencies (100, 200, 500, 1k, 2k, 4k, and 10k). Thats far more than I expected from such an affordable 1080p LCD TV.There are settings specifically for PCs, which makes sense because it has 2 HDMI inputs and a VGA as well.

Reviews.Title: Awesome for the price
Reviews.Author: tokadub "tokadub"
Reviews.Content: I wanted to find something fun to buy for Black Friday/Cyber Monday and a TV was on the top of my list. However out of all the TV deals I found this one was the only one which really stood out to me. The price point for this TV is really good for it's size.I managed to get this TV + wall mount (http://www.amazon.com/dp/B000WYVBR0/ref=pe_175190_21431760_M3T1_SC_dp_1) + shipping + tax for just barely under $300! Not to shabby Amazon I can't complain, Black Friday Rules!This TV gets 4/5 stars for the value. But I cannot go with 5/5 because it seems that the picture quality could be a little better. It seems to me that this TV gets a little bit blurry when adjusting it's images (things moving on screen). I don't know if its a slow refresh rate or the pixel/screen quality is just not as good as it could be. However it is not very bad, some people might not even notice. It could just be that I am so used to my very nice LG monitor, and bigger screens always seem to lose some visual crispness/quality with the fine details.I think it sounds OK for a bedroom on low-mid volume settings (while watching TV). But when trying to play video games it becomes VERY apparent that these speakers do not have a good dynamic range. If you want to listen loud or do anything with crazy sound effects you will want a speaker system for this. Although I have only had the TV a few days it is possible the speakers might break in a little bit and sound better for gaming (kinda doubt it).If you want bang for your buck get this TV! If you want amazing quality you should spend more... it just seems there are not very many reasonable options unless you go WAY above this price point.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding value!
Reviews.Author: J. Wann
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my mother, and I was pleasantly surprised by the overall quality, packaging and features.  At $259, this 39" TV is a terrific value.  Setup was easy.  It even came with a small Phillips screwdriver to attach the base.  (By the way, a couple of reviewers commented that their Sceptre TVs fell forward off their table.  I believe they may have attached the base backwards, with the wider part of the base incorrectly facing the rear of the TV.  The set is very stable when the wider part of the base faces front per the assembly instructions.)Mom previously had an analog TV that required a small cable converter to convert the digital signal for her 20 basic cable channels to analog.  We eliminated this converter, and in about 10 minutes, the Sceptre's clear QAM tuner found 40 digital cable channels.  Many of these extra channels were of no interest to my mother and we were able to easily "skip" these from the channel scan.  Picture quality is very good.  The remote is logically laid out, but the buttons and labels are a bit small for many older-persons' eyes.The sound was very tinny at first but after adjusting the equalizer settings under a "user" profile, we were able to add some bass and reduce some of the treble.  The sound is still not great, but much improved from the out-of-the-box setting.I would recommend this TV to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Great Value for the money,  large Flat-Screen LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Rusty Sly
Reviews.Content: The instructions are the best I've used for most electronic devices, and assembly  of the large base was quick and easy. There is no tilt, but it swivels easily. (A screwdriver is supplied.)I've read most of the reviews of this TV. Most agree the built-in sound is not great, and they are absolutely correct in my opinion. Not a consideration for me since I feed the audio signal from the cable box hdmi jack to an AV Receiver. The TV's speakers are weak and a little shrill, however I believe most people will probably use a sound bar or a receiver to process the sound. In addition to the speakers, the TV has a digital sound output jack for a dedicated sound bar. (Keep in mind that the hdmi jack also carries the digital sound.) Also, there is a head-set jack that produces excellent sound in my Panasonic hi-fi stereo head-set.Additionally, the remote is clearly labeled and easy to use, and the initial set-up is clearly described. The instructions note that two people should assemble it, but I'm a skinny old man, and I was able to do it without help.Now as to the picture quality, it is very good. Not excellent, because I couldn't get a setting that would lower the contrast to see detailed dark portions of images, without dimming the picture. But, considering the very low price of the TV, I gave it five stars, relative to it's crystal clear picture, and vivid colors. Most of the low-price 39 or 40-inch TVs are priced around a hundred dollars or more higher, with negligent increase in picture quality. For that difference in price, a sound-bar with sub-woofer, would provide superior sound to any of the more expensive TVs in this class. Also note that the VESA mounting is 200mm by 300mm, not 200 by 200 as noted in the description.

Reviews.Title: WARNING: DO NOT BE TRICKED
Reviews.Author: dwolf47
Reviews.Content: This TV WILL break within 6 months, if you make it a year you are lucky. It is under warranty BUT you will spend several hundred dollars having it shipped to California unless you live right there.

Reviews.Title: This TV is awesome!
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I use this TV for my computer monitor. Now, you might ask yourself, "Isn't 40 inches of monitor, sitting right in front of you at your desk, a tad bit ridiculous?". You bet it is! That is what makes it so fantastic!I play all my games and it looks perfect, you just have to find your best resolution. No ghost images, or cloudy movement. The colors are also great, and it can dim down a bit if you need, so the brightness doesn't scorch your eyeballs from their sockets.Got it fast and had it workin' in no time. Overall, I am very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: jajodo
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice buy.  I usually purchase higher end but wanted an inexpensive TV for the play room.  I was worrying about buying an LCD TV in an LED world but made a good choice.Pros;-The picture really is quite nice.  Not $2000 nice, but surprisingly good-Lots of connections: more than lower end LED TVs.  Have it plugged into Roku, Verizon box and Wii with slots to spare.-Energy efficient.  $14 estimated yearly energy cost.  Compares well with LEDs-Lighter than most LCDs-Very little heat emmited-Price, price, price.Cons:-The sound is not fabulous.  It is not a problem for talk shows and news but not so great for action movies.  Fortunately the TV has digital and analog out to plug into your choice of amps / speakers.-Depth.  The unit is thicker than LEDs but not shocking in any way.  Mine is in a corner setup and the depth is irrelevant.  If you plan to place it on a wall where it will be seen on end be prepared for a thicker look than LED.-Stand.  I mention it only because others have.  Seems reasonably stable to me with a nice pivot.  I did not expect it to be as stable as my high end Samsung.  I think It would take an unfortunate incident to break it.Over all a very worthy product.  I recommend it as a primary TV if you are a casual viewer and it makes an excellent choice for the kid's room.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Good TV - Great Price
Reviews.Author: Kaiser Jack
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Scepter TV . They all have a marvelous picture . The sound is somewhat tinny but most flat screens suffer this problem because of rear facing speakers . The only disapointment is that the stalk for the table base is built on,and not removable from , the back of the TV . If you are table-top its ok , but if you wall mount it hangs down . Ugly ! I table-topped so it's ok for me . I have a 42" and a 32" which came with removable bases . Much better . That said , it is a good TV at a great price. It has lots of sourse inputs and outlets for a sound system if you want . The remote is easy to use and has a simple sleep timer which made it a perfect Tv for our bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Sceptre X408BV-FHD TV
Reviews.Author: D. J.  Sharp
Reviews.Content: This chinese TV could be an excelent product if not for the sound. The picture is excellent and the controls, inputs/outputs are what most people will need. I wish I had bought two of them when the price was only $269 in November 2012. But, as I said, the sound is poor. The TV is thin and that may be why they could not use better speakers. I was looking to buy a sound bar that cost less that $200 when I remembered that I had a Boston BA635 speaker system with subwoofer. WOW! did it make a world of difference. It plugs into the headphone jack on the TV and volume is still controled by the Sceptre remote control. Some sound bars, the volume has to be controled by its remote control. I don't want more remotes. If you watch ebay, you should be able to find a BA635 system for less than $50. Be sure it is a BA635 and not a BA735. BA735 does not connect by headphone jack, It must use a special digital cord and not all TV's use this digital output. You can't believe the volume and sound this little system puts out. I listened to several bar speaker systems and none sound better than the Boston speakers. Other than the sound, yes I would recomend this Sceptre TV.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price, great for a second room TV.
Reviews.Author: Gregory M. Spitzer "Mark Spitzer"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for the room i use as an office, straight out of the box the picture and sound on this tv are not very good and you have to adjust the picture and the sound from the menu. I set the sound settings as Bass 7, Treble 9, Surround On, and ALV On. Then the sound is ok, but I would not want to use this TV is my living room without connecting it to some type of sound system, the sound is ok in an office room, or bedroom, I connected it to an external sound system to watch football games or watch action movies. The picture on the TV only looks good if you connect it via the HDMI inputs, the other inputs look pretty poor. For the price if you connect this tv to an HDMI connection and are planning to use it as a secondary TV, I think you would be satisfied with it. If you planned on always running it through an external sound system, it would be pretty good for your primary TV.

Reviews.Title: TV has difficulty with motion.
Reviews.Author: Andrew Johns "Andy"
Reviews.Content: This is the strangest TV I've ever had. It has difficulty processing motion, so parts of the picture lag behind others.  The color saturation is also not realistic, so many scenes almost seem cartoon-like when they are not.

Reviews.Title: Awesome T.V. !!
Reviews.Author: Verona
Reviews.Content: It has great resolution for all of my video games. The sound is excellent too! Decent price for the quality :D

Reviews.Title: for a price, you can't beat it!
Reviews.Author: Yurs Truly "Yurs Truly"
Reviews.Content: quality overall looks good for this great price i purchased ($229) ... only con so far is the stand, too flimsy and looks like its so easy to break..

Reviews.Title: Very good picture but limited options for connections and the sound is terrible.
Reviews.Author: matrix
Reviews.Content: Very nice picture but limited options for connections and the sound is terrible. We decided to hook it up to a surround sound system but then realized it didn't have a connection for one so we had to get an older style sound bar and plug it in through the headphone jack now at least it sounds good.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Lonnie
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a short term replacement while I had my Samsung repaired. Not really apples to apples considering the Samsung cost five times more over four years ago.  The only real problem I have with the Sceptre (keeping in mind what I paid for it) is the sound. It often seems to increase of decrease on it's on and the quality isn't what I'm used to. Other than that it's a great TV for the price.

Reviews.Title: dud tv
Reviews.Author: Carolyn Buck
Reviews.Content: I had this tv for less than 3months and it just shut off one day while watching it and never turned back on!!!!

Reviews.Title: Good quality without brand name price
Reviews.Author: Artie Hrdz
Reviews.Content: I originally bought this tv in September 2013 and since then have been really satisfied with my purchase. First, though I would like to preface my comments with the fact that this is the first flatscreen television I have ever owned in my 24 years of life having only used old box tvs from the 90s. Now with that out of the way lets review the product.I was a bit hesitant to buy this television as I had never heard of the manufacturer. However, after some research I found that some of Wal-Mart's best selling tvs were this brand (take that as you will). I had read some of the reviews here about picture quality as well as audio quality not being stellar but decided that for, at the time $230 w/free shipping, it was worth the potential risk. Firstly I have to say, that coming from a standard old 27 inch Magnavox set, the picture is superb. This is especially true after doing some basic calibration, search google for AVS HD 709, the picture is in my opinion at least an 8 out of 10. I dropped two points only because on the extreme viewing angles on the edge the picture seems to degrade but this seems to be a problem with some flatscreen sets. I mainly use this tv for gaming (Xbox 360, PS2, GameCube) and streaming content (Netflix, Crunchyroll, HuluPlus, YouTube) and I am happy with the results. The specs on the tv say that the refresh rate is 6.5ms which I have only noticed affecting gameplay when I am extremely focused with what is happening on the screen (FPS, Fighting, Racing). As for audio quality I use this tv set in my room, which is about the size of your average american university dorm, and it can get quite loud. I rarely turn it up above 30. Now lets break everything down.Pros-Picture Quality (after some calibration)-Audio Quality (after some setting changes)-Form factor (takes up way less space than my old set)-Inputs (3 HDMI, Component, Composite, PC)-1080pCons-Needs some fiddling with (Out of box settings should be changed to get best quality)-Power Saving mode (when you change settings power savings mode is removed)-AVL (auto volume level sometimes makes content too low or too loud, can be turned off)I would greatly recommend this television set to anyone.P.S. Here are my personal Video and Audio settingsVideo-Brightness 46-Contrast 74-Color 44-Tint 0-Sharpness 35-Screen Size Full 100%-Color Temperature Normal-Advanced Picture Settings all offSound-Bass, Treble, Balance all set to 0-Surround Mode off-AVL off-Speaker on-Digital Audio Output PCM-Equalizer off

Reviews.Title: A Budget Brand That Won't Break In 2 Years
Reviews.Author: Luke K.
Reviews.Content: I want to start off by saying that I DO NOT own this TV, but before you stop reading, know this.  I bought a Sceptre 24' LCD TV in August of 2008.  At that time many HDTV's around the size I was looking for went for upwards of $450-500 if you wanted say a Panasonic, Sony, or Samsung TV.  I spent a modest $350 for my TV, which at the time was a very good deal. Apart from single stalled pixel right out of the box, my Sceptre TV ran like a champ and is STILL working just fine.  That's right, 5 years later my Sceptre TV is still running great, no dead pixels, no loss in sound, the worst thing that has happened is all the numbers rubbed off the remote, big deal.Bottom line, if you're in the market for a new TV, but don't want to break the bank, or have a new TV die on you in 2-3 years, this is the brand to go with.  It's an American company based out of California, and I would definitely buy from them again if they produce more TV's with better specs.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Joshua Adams
Reviews.Content: Fantastic, works great, I use it for cable, xbox, dvd's, and streaming through a HDMI cable from my laptop. Very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for....
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: The sound from this TV is terrible. I can turn it all the way up while watching a NFL game and cannot hear what the announcers are saying. I have it set up as a kitchen TV that duplicates what is on in the living room, so it's not terrible for what I'm using it for. Other than the bad sound, this is a fairly thick TV. It's twice to three times as thick as modern plasmas / lcds.

Reviews.Title: As good as any other
Reviews.Author: Jesse Jones
Reviews.Content: TV works perfectly fine, even on a component connection. Sound quality is good. Picture quality is good. Black Levels and contrast are just fine. Everything looks the way I wanted to and expected it to. Easily worth the money.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT TV Well worth it!
Reviews.Author: Kush Patel
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV and ordered it with the 2 day shipping of Amazon Prime, which I recommend because its awesome, and I got it on the exact delivery date as it said on the tracking.The packaging was very simple but also very well packaged. The entire TV had a plastic wrap over it so that was good in terms of traveling in a box.Now for the TV itself. When i first turned this TV on and tweaked with the settings to get the best picture quality, it just always looked grainy and the colors were distorted (also, I sit just about 3 and a half feet away from it). But I did a lot of research on getting the best picture quality and turned out I kept the sharpness way too high. So I put that on 3 and adjusted the contrast and all that and then wow. I was amazed at how crystal clear this TV really is. The blacks are dark blacks and whites are decent. So you just really have to adjust the Picture Settings a lot until it looks amazing cause trust me it will. So I am giving this TV five stars for the price and the quality. Will buy from Sceptre again definetly.Here are the picture settings I use on my TV:brightness: 49contrast: 49color: 47tint: 0sharpness: 3color temp: normaldynamic contrast: offfilm mode: on if watching movie, off when playing video gamesnoise reduction: offmpeg noise reduction: off

Reviews.Title: Good enough
Reviews.Author: B. Saetern "College Guy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for my bedroom because I like to fall asleep while watching movies, shows, etc..... As stated by many reviewers, the picture quality looks great, however the sound is not all that great. It has a buzzing noise, crackling sound when not adjusted correctly, and even trying to adjust it, I feel as though its only bearable.  I would suggest getting a sound system as it has an audio output.  I also bought a wall mount for this tv but it didn't fit.  Although it states that it is 200 x 200 vesa standard, it was not.  Its more like 300 x 200 or 400 x 200.  I don't really remember.  I ended up using the wall mount for on a different tv.  The menu looks mediocre, and the control design is a bit intimidating but expected as this was the cheapest 40 in tv I could find at below $300.  I got it at $259. Overall a decent tv for people on a budget.

Reviews.Title: Not VESA 200 x 200!!!!  It's 300 x 200.
Reviews.Author: Brittani
Reviews.Content: Just got it, but seems nice enough for the price.  Buyer beware - it's listed here as 200 x 200, but the TV that arrived is 300 x 200.  Minus one star for that.

Reviews.Title: Wow this tv for the price..... Just wow
Reviews.Author: Rapture
Reviews.Content: So I bought this tv for 259 bucks off amazon .  I had already checked the reviews and it does in fact come in power save mode, so out of the box the screen looks dull.  If you fiddle with the settings and change it to vivid, this tv works great.  Color and picture is excellent.  Really the only thing it lacks that I want out of a good looking tv, is movie quality sound.  The speakers are not so great and when turning up the volume it gets somewhat crackly.  Luckily I happened to have  just a regular 20 dollar set of computer speakers with a subwoofer.  I plugged them into the tv's usb port for power and connected them to the audio ouputs, turned out the lights and the computer speakers did the trick.  Really any set of aftermarket speakers would help.  For 259 dollars  I am very happy with this tv.  Purchased the protection plan though, because hey you never know...... I mean it was cheap.

Reviews.Title: Fine TV for a great price...delivered with Prime
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: We really like the TV.  The picture is excellent and can be adjusted in many ways if you don't care for the "default".Some reviewers didn't like the sound and it probably sounds much better with some really good external speakers.  For extra money, of course.  Our son has the 50" version connected to his sound system amp and it sounds great.  The sound can be adjusted quite a bit with  the bass and treble AND equalizer controls.  It sounds fine to us.Easy to set up with plenty of input/outputs.  We are about 40 miles from Dallas and get several channels on rabbit ears. We use the TV for streaming video (Amazon, Netflix, etc.) via a $50 Roku HD and seldom watch broadcast except for news and PBS which come in fine...most of the time.I would definitely recommend this TV.  Get your HDMI cables for about $3 as add-ons at the same time.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat it!
Reviews.Author: RONALD SZYMANSKI
Reviews.Content: Great picture, a very simple setup, low cost, a real super value for the price!  would highly recommend this TV .

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Majic
Reviews.Content: I've been  using this TV for a few months... for the size/price, it's great!  Out of the box easy set up.

Reviews.Title: A great product
Reviews.Author: LAUREN M STEPHANS
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant to get a TV that wasn't a big name brand, but those fears were unfounded.  I highly recommend this TV if you are looking for a flat screen that won't break the bank.  Very easy set-up with all of our devices, too!

Reviews.Title: perfect flat screens but no perks
Reviews.Author: michael
Reviews.Content: Great t.v but nothing extra. Perfect flatcreen if that's all your looking for which satisfied me.  Especially for the price

Reviews.Title: Great second TV
Reviews.Author: TC
Reviews.Content: The TV was easy to set up right out of the box. It is in a bedroom and is brighter than the one replaced, but no problems. I would not hesitate in getting this brans again.

Reviews.Title: tv review
Reviews.Author: Laniej
Reviews.Content: It would be 5 stars if the sound were better. That is the only thing I don't like. The color is great and I haven't had any other problems. For the price it is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Great bed room TV
Reviews.Author: russell bradshaw
Reviews.Content: I read lots of reviews before buying this set, the picture is great, they are right, the remote is useless, i had to set it up using the buttons on the side but it wasn't very difficult, i bought the suggested cord, the way to go, called dish network who helped set my dish remote to work with the tv, @5 minutes, now everything works great. bought the cable for my lap top, pluged it in, switched to pc and Vuala, the tv is now a really big moniter, then just switch back to TV.It is a great bed room tv, we are very happy with it, yes the speaker are weak, sound Tiny when you first turn it on but can be adjusted, if you have a window air conditioner in the bed room you might have problems hearing it, it's fine for us.the suggested wall mount fits fine. I would spend the extra couple of hundred dollars if you are looking for a livingroom TV, by the time you buy a decent speaker bar you'll end up spending it any way, unless you already plan to or have speakers then it is a fine TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for its price but beware of sound
Reviews.Author: G. Garabigie "George"
Reviews.Content: I knew about the sound coming into this but I don't mind it much because it's being used in a small room. The quality if the TV itself is really great though.

Reviews.Title: Sceptre 40 inch lcd hdtv
Reviews.Author: rockford young
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on this tv, and it is the best in it,s catagorie. Very well put together, Not a flar on it, works very well, just unpack it, plkug it in, and turn it on! Sceptre really surprised me, as I was unpacking the tv, I found a small well put together screwdriver, that is used to assemble the mounting bracket, and s small cleaning pad, to keep the screen clean! Who does that???

Reviews.Title: Super set!
Reviews.Author: Mickey
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical of this TV as I had never heard of the brand, but was I ever pleasantly surprised! What a great set. This set has plenty of HDMI in puts as well as RCA and coax connections. Remote is nice and easy to use, not too cluttered and the Picture rivals any other set I've had, even a plasma. The blacks are black and the colors pretty true to life. I would not hesitate to purchase another of this brand!

Reviews.Title: Maybe for the price, it's o.k.
Reviews.Author: Theodore S. Hopf
Reviews.Content: I am disappointed with the sound system. It lacks good definition and I have to adjust the sound depending upon whether the channel is HD or not. Visual is o.k.

Reviews.Title: Best of its kind for the price.
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: If this TV was $100 more I'd probably give it 4 stars for the awful audio quality and ugly glossiness of the screen. For the price, however, what more can you ask for? The video quality is terrific for everything I've thrown at it: movies, sports, and games. If I had to buy another TV for the same purposes again I would buy this is an instant. If you're on the fence because of the audio quality then don't get it. If you don't care about that or you have separate speakers then I definitely recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: gwrulz
Reviews.Content: First off I have to say I am unhappy with how Amazon shipped it, they just slapped the shipping label on the outside of the (very detailed) box and left it on my front door step (actually UPS left it).  If I hadn't been home for lunch that day it could have been stolen very easily.  I note this to make everyone aware.The TV works pretty good, it is suppose to be 1080 but the resolution I get is less.The cost made up for it though, so I am recommending it as it works pretty good.

Reviews.Title: Poor color
Reviews.Author: FatMark
Reviews.Content: I will not comment on audio, I have an external sound bar I use which is great and did not try the audio on the TV.My problem with the TV is the color is horrible. When everything is nice and bright outside the picture and color is great, very vibrant. Problem is a lot of things I watch tend to not be exclusively outside. When it is dark, tan faces turn pink and lighter complexion the faces go white/green like the character are sick. People of dark complexion go blotchy like they are covered in mud.Maybe I just got a bad TV, I tried as long as I could to get used to it, spent hours messing with the limited picture controls in attempt to resolve this with no results. The TV for my bedroom has the option to alter amounts of specific colors like RGB which this TV does not. After 2 weeks of use(owned for slightly longer but unable to use in the process of a move) I am returning it in hopes of a refund, it is too bad for me to try and get used to.

Reviews.Title: Sceptre TV--worth the price
Reviews.Author: Don Smith
Reviews.Content: The Sceptre is a fantastic buy for the price, particularly for a 40" TV.  The image is very good and the sound is of average or above quality.

Reviews.Title: Amazing deal.
Reviews.Author: christopher Smeltz
Reviews.Content: I spent much time reading through the reviews and weighting the risk of buying this t.v. online. In the end I have choose to buy this t.v. which was the best decisions overall. This product has not caused me a single issue and it works wonderfully.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: GrigsWall
Reviews.Content: For Once a good buy has paid off for us in the world of TV purchases, The Sceptre we purchased is easy to set up, works well with external sound system, and has, especially for the money, an outstanding picture quality when viewing HD Programming, I would recommend this TV to anyone looking for a good value.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the $
Reviews.Author: Jeff Sargeant
Reviews.Content: At first I was sceptical because the price was so low, but I read a few reviews and they were all good (excluding the sound quality).  Since I have a surround reciever already I didn't care if any sound at all was produced so that was not an issue.  The picture quality however is great!  I was very impressed by how good the overall look of the color, and the contrast is.  I watch a lot of TV Cable shows and other than the usual compression artifacts typical with cable, the picture quality was a true representation of what the producers intended.  I'm a video engineer by trade, so I get to watch video on some of the most expensive proffesional monitors and I can say that this TV is much better than I expected.  I recomend it to anyone on a budget.  You can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: Decent for the price
Reviews.Author: J. Harkess
Reviews.Content: I put it in a bedroom and it works great.The picture quality I might be able to argue about it being able to compete with my other 40inch TV that cost 3x as much.The sound quality is horrible so ended up with a 2.1 setup since I didn't want to run wires around the room for 5.1Just a note when I bought this it said the VESA mount was 200x200 so I purchased a wall mount with a max of that size. After getting the TV it turns out the correct size is 300x200. Not a huge deal but worth knowing if you are buying the wall mount before you get the TV in hand.

Reviews.Title: Best Bang for the Buck! Excellent all around TV. Sharp Picture!!
Reviews.Author: Loren S. Young "The Bigdog"
