Reviews.Title: Great television for the price
Reviews.Author: Darrin Dailey
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for $288 about mid-December.  I found this to be a very good price for a 39" 1080p.  I was looking at LED, 120Hz models, but I just couldn't justify the additional expense.  Anyway, on to the goods.The unit was packaged very securely.  No box damage and not a mark on the TV.  Setup was very easy.  The remote is lightweight and functional.  There were no dead pixels.  I plugged in the Blu-Ray player with HDMI and everything worked like it should.The picture is really good.  I've seen better as everyone has, but again for <$300, this picture is amazing.My son remarked that he can play Skyrim on the X-box from the couch across the room and still read all the tiny text.  The Wii looks great. Streaming Netflix looks pixelated but that's due to slow internet, not picture quality.  I've not played a Blu-Ray movie on it yet, though.The loss of one star is because of the audio.  It's plenty loud and the quality is sufficient, but the speakers are small and it doesn't take much bass to rattle them out at the bottom.  If you choose external audio, then this becomes a non-issue.I bought mounting hardware at the same time and it mounted up just fine.  It has a flat back which makes mounting a snap.  It's also a fairly lightweight TV and I was able to mount it myself.All in all, this TV is doing everything I wanted it to do and it's doing it for less than $300.  That's hard to beat.

Previous problem obviously not operator error as this unit works just fine. Good sound but do not expect it to sound like a full system, it's just a TV! If you want great sound, add an AV system with Subwoofer. Tuner setup finds all the digital and analog channels available on my standard TW cable just fine. Reviews.Title: A very good TV for the price with some minor flaws.
Reviews.Author: Tri Cao Nguyen
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell I needed to replace a 32" Vizio monitor that I was using for gaming for quite some time.  Since I saw this for sale on Black Friday week for under $270 shipped, I decided to take the plunge.  One of the most important things I want to stress about this monitor is its size.  Here are the official specs straight from Sceptre36.5"(W) x 25.2 "(H) x 11.1 "(D) (With Stand)36.5"(W) x 22.8 "(H) x 4.5 "(D) (Without Stand)26.01 lbs (With Stand)For a 40" television that is exactly 36.5 inches, it was a blessing for me who had limited space to work with.  Most folks who have old fashioned television cabinets will find it still fits inside the main frame, so that's a plus if you're one of those.Since I don't have a huge background in reviewing electronics or the tools to make accurate measurements; I'll just briefly describe the quality of the picture and the color rendition in simple terms.The quality of the picture at its native resolution (1920x1080 60hz) looks just fine.  I've had no issues with motion blur / lag with the few games I've played on it.  The main thing I want to point out is the color reproduction, which feels over-saturated.  As much as I tried to fiddle around with the presets built into the monitor as well as manually adjusting the sliders to an appropriate level; there's nothing I could do to make blacks look dark.  Most blacks look bluish/gray, and this may turn off a lot of folks who will be using this as a television mainly for movies.  I also want to note that the white presets are bluish on "Cool" and "Normal".  I actually found "Warm" to be what most televisions consider "Normal" in terms of color temperature.I would recommend this television primarily for its size first and quality second.  It's a heck of a lot better than most budget televisions out there on the market, and I think as long as you keep your expectations in check for the price you paid for this unit you'll be happy with it.  As a PC monitor it's great, but it may not be for everyone as a dedicated television.

Reviews.Title: Labeled as 40 Inches?!
Reviews.Author: Austin Prime
Reviews.Content: So I ordered this TV 2 weeks ago. It arrived a day late and the damage to the packaging was insane. It was incredibly damaged. When I opened it, there was damage to the screen on the tv. I returned it to Amazon.When I purchased this TV the specs said it was a 40 inch tv. It even shows in my Amazon orders that I ordered a 40 inch TV. They re-ordered it for me and the name has changed to 39 inch TV. False advertising... especially when it turns out this TV is actually only 38.5 inches. ***UPDATE*** Turns out they had it labeled wrong on Amazon. Now they have fixed it. Still pissed that when I bought it it said 40 inch.I am more than mad about this.
